Reviews.Title: “You pay for the location”
Reviews.Author: JLGabroad
Reviews.Content: This is a decent price for the location...it pays to be near the major sights and the tram. It's literally a five-minute walk from the Hagia Sophia (unless you have little kids like us - it's more like 12 minutes). The breakfast terrace on the roof has a view out to the Sea of Marmara. The hotel itself is on a side road without through traffic, so I imagine it is quieter than some of the hotels on the main roads in Sultanahmet. The service was fine. The breakfast was no-frills and I have had many better breakfasts in several other Turkish hotels. They arranged fairly-priced airport transfers for us, though, which was very convenient. We had the family room in the basement, which had a large bed, two singles, and a baby crib - it fit us fine and we didn't feel cramped. Even though it was in the "basement," the slope of the road made it so we actually had a fairly picturesque view into the side roads of Sultanahmet. We did have a small problem with a few ants the first day or two, but it wasn't a big deal and it was taken care of quickly. Internet and TV worked fine. I'd recommend this place for the location and no-fuss quality (but the breakfast was nothing special).

Reviews.Title: “5 star location at 3 star prices!”
Reviews.Author: A L
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a find (thanks lonely planet!). Frankly, it is a bit underrated. The hotel is not too big which I liked as it gives a more personal experience. First, let me highlight the service at this hotel - every single one of the staff members was super helpful and friendly. Anything we asked about, they helped us with. Most importantly, they let us know that because of Ramadan, we needed to get a tour agent to help us with our travel plans because the day we were planning on travelling was a major holiday for the Turkish people and travel by bus and train would be near impossible. The location of this hotel was also ideal. It was just a hop away from the Topkapi palace and the Aya Sofya (Hagia Sophia). I cannot rave enough about the location! There is also a laundry shop just down the street which has reasonable prices and did a good job. The restaurants are all just down the street from the hotel. The room itself was nice - nothing super special, but comfortable and with air conditioning. There is a rooftop terrace where they have breakfast and you can enjoy the lovely views. We often went up there to just relax. The breakfast they served was plentiful and with fresh vegetables and fruits in addition to some meats and cheeses. Get there early though or they run out of the hard-boiled eggs - they only cook that once in the morning and once they run out, that is it. We highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again if ever back in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lechatlisse
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother and her husband a few months back and the reviews are right, it's a lovely place to stay. It is in the Backpacker area, but that actually has it's advantages sometimes. The rooms are nicely decorated and very clean, good amenities etc. My only complaint against the rooms is that there is specious little soundproofing so you can hear any noise from the stairwell and foyer. Nothing that a good pair of earplugs won't block out though. The breakfast and the terrace are just divine, very clean, generous, healthy and a wide variety. The view is spectacular. But the crown jewel is the staff. Mustafa is the kindest, most welcoming host you'll meet, and very clued up about the best things to see or avoid. He gladly arranged travel for us, advised us on shopping and made reservations at restaurants for us. Thank you Mustafa!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Suebri_11
Reviews.Content: We walked around the area and found the Alp Guesthouse at the beginning of October. We paid a small deposit for them to reserve a room for us for when we returned to Istanbul at the end of October. We had caught the night bus from Antalya and arrived a day earlier than anticipated and before 8:00am! They welcomed us for breakfast and were able to accommodate us even though we were a day early for our reservation. The room was ready for us before noon. The rooms are decorated in Ottoman style furniture, the view from our room and the terrace was wonderful. The location is very close to the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sophia and has so many good restaurants within blocks. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: Georgie L
Reviews.Content: Arriving after an overnight flight we were happy to come to this gorgeous hotel. We were greeted by friendly staff, who were very polite and helpful. The family room was cosy and peaceful. The breakfasts were great and the view from the rooftop were magnificent. Great location! We really enjoyed our time their, i really recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best location for a stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jdlane
Reviews.Content: The Alp is located exactly where any visitor would want to be: short walking distance to all the major sights and restaurants while at the same time being somewhat secluded and quiet. The terrace up top has amazing views of Bosphorous and Sea of Marmara. The double we had wasn't giant but wasn't too small either, I think the four poster bed makes it look small when you walk in. The Alp also is very secure since there is basically only one way in and out of the place which is manned 24/7. The staff are very helpful and genuine, offering us umbrellas on the days it rained and giving us directions to the small grocery stores where we bought all the souvenir chocolate and coffee for a fraction of what was being charged elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful location in Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: kalena195
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! The price was reasonable and you couldn't ask for a better location, within walking distance to all the main sites in Instanbul. Breakfast on the terrace overlooking the Bosphorus was a daily treat and also having access to the terrace during the rest of the day was great, as we would come back after our day of sightseeing to have a beer before going out to dinner. Both the front desk fellas (both named Mustafa), were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “good location and clean”
Reviews.Author: WOTME
Reviews.Content: stayed for 7 days at end of September,found rooms clean and quite well furnished although a bit on the small side. no bath, only shower but again kept clean. door key fob for lights a bit of nuisance,having to take in and out of lock, and when out of room the fridge turns off. no charge for safe key,a rarity in turkey. now to the not so good bits,breakfast,if you are a veggie you wont have much to complain about ,cereals,fruit,tomatoes,cucumber,cake,even the "meat "sausage was anemic,and as for the boiled eggs,you have to get up early,i give up after 3 days,seems some people were taking more than there fair share,and when there gone.there gone.and it is the same food every day no alternatives. one thing that can be a problem to some will be the stairs,they are literally a spiral staircase in marble and quite steep,and with the breakfast on the roof it could be a problem,there is no lift. to recap good ,location,but take some ear plugs, clean and tidy, staff help full, not so good breakfast, stairs,

Reviews.Title: “Great location, loud rooms”
Reviews.Author: kanestel
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the location of this hotel. It's right in the mix of all the bars and restaurants in the old Istanbul area and near all the major sites of Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque, etc.. However, because of the marble steps in the hotel, if you want to sleep in it's nearly impossible. People are tramping up and down the marble steps in their sandals and it sounds like stomping and echoes throughout the building. The restaurant is on the roof so when people wake to get breakfast if you're on the top floor below the restaurant, you hear everyone stomping and talking as they go up to breakfast. The rooms are very small, just large enough to have your suitcases and a bed in it. THe beds weren't that comfortable, but they were sufficient. The breakfast was also good. Nice service at the front desk and a decent value. Also keep in mind you're located near two major mosques to the 5 AM call to prayer is extremely loud.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: JLK9
Reviews.Content: Good location, especially for Topkapi and easy access to Kennedy freeway for airport. Lovely rooftop terrace with terrific views of the Bosphorus. Adequate breakfast, but could have stood improvement. Staff was very nice. You could take their notebook computer to your room or up to the terrace to use.

Reviews.Title: “an amazing stay in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Brad O
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice during our trip to Turkey. Family room fit five (snugly), but the same room was later used for a much more enjoyable triple. The staff are friendly and helpful, even lending out a netbook when we needed to make some additional travel arrangements. Breakfast is beautiful with a view of Asia in the distance. Great.

Reviews.Title: “Adored it”
Reviews.Author: Georgieandfamily
Reviews.Content: As a family we loved to stay at this hotel. The staff were so friendly and welcoming. We loved the morning breakfasts on the terrace. This hotel is also in a great location. Ideal!!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: VinterBug
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, nice breakfast room and terrace. Room is clean and has comfortable bed. Shower box is tiny but overall clean. Wooden floor makes creaky noise and room faces some kind of ruined backyard, which was a bit disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view, fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: gamlegorm
Reviews.Content: The location is great - very close to the main tourist attractions and a great view of the Bosphorus from the dining room or veranda on the top floor. But the best thing about this hotel is the absolutely incredible hospitality of the staff. Our family group of four were there for a week in two rooms. We had a medical emergency halfway through our stay. Murat the manager and Mustafa an assisstant were extremely helpful - many thanks to you both.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JMenOttawa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated perfectly. Restaurants, shops, convenience stores and cafes at the doorstep. All the sights (blue mosque, Aya Sofia, Basilica Cistern, etc) are under 10 minutes away by foot. The hotel is great value for the cost; the rooms are clean, safe, include air conditioning, free wifi, but are on the smallish side. But you are in Istanbul! What are you doing in your hotel room?!? The rooftop terrace is perfect for the continental breakfast as well as chilling out reading or having a beer in the evening. The terrace has both a covered and uncovered section, but wake up early if you want to eat breakfast in the sun. The Grand Bazaar is maximum 20 minutes by foot from the hotel and the Spice Bazaar less than another 10.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: atomcat
Reviews.Content: Located in a quiet street in the heart of guesthouses/boutique hotels in Sultanahmet, close to restaurants, Arasta Bazaar, small supermarket (selling alcohol), tram stop & major sights of Istanbul (Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern). Stayed in a room on the 2nd floor + the basement - both were fine. Welcome cupboard, drawers, desk to spread out without tripping over backpacks/possessions. Towels changed everyday. In the room: bar fridge, TV (not satellite), air-cond. Breakfast served on roof terrace - generous buffet provisions of cereal, yoghurt, fresh fruit, pastries & the usual cucumber/tomato/olives/hard-boiled eggs/bread/spreads. Welcome hot/cold water + complimentary instant coffee & variety of teas. Roof terrace was a great place to chill & watch the 'traffic' on the Sea of Marmara. We had our own 'happy hour' every evening with snacks & beer bought from the supermarket nearby. Reception staff were helpful & friendly: booked seats for the Mevlevi Sema Ceremony & booked airport transport (20 euros) for our departure. Small library on ground floor with travel books/novels in different languages. Our only gripe: enforced 4:30am wake-up 'call' from the mosque next door!!! Good value at 70 euros/night. Many thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “Love the ALP”
Reviews.Author: D1223chicago
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Alp. Great rooms, wonderful breakfast. Resonable prices and FANTASTIC location. The staff is very helpful and speak good english. :):)

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, friendly, quiet, small, good value hotel in a great position.”
Reviews.Author: ducksoup11
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days here and were delighted with our choice. Our room was clean and quiet; there is a great view of the Bosphorus and Sea of Marmara from the roof terrace and the staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Guesthouse Alp will be my choice next time again!”
Reviews.Author: evaistanbul
Reviews.Content: We were very lucky to find a room there in the busy week after Easter. The room was clean and had a good atmosphere, the views over an old mosque and into various private gardens was very pittoresque. The service was excellent, always friendly and helpful, and it is a place where it gets very quiet in the night, although you are right in the center of Sultanachmet district.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff, great rooms and good price.”
Reviews.Author: johnmalc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in many hotels on our Turkey trip, and this is right up there with the best. The rooms are excellent (four-poster beds, dimmer switches on every light, bliss!), the staff went out of their way to be helpful. Situated in the old town so quiet, but surrounded by restaurants (good and bad) and some excellent bars. Roof terrace (covered and open) has views of the Bosphorous, wonderful for breakfasting by, and the price of â‚¬70 per night was excellent value for money. Thanks guys, you made a good trip even better.

Reviews.Title: “Better than my expectation”
Reviews.Author: SSline
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in great location. Even it is very close to busy street, you may hear some noise but you are not in such chaos. Room is nice, the rate is acceptable. Just fits to me which I never want to stay at hotel even the weather was bad. Do not forget to bring your plug adaptors if you are travelling from UK

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay in good location”
Reviews.Author: ss345
Reviews.Content: A friendly kind of hotel, which was renamed as Alp guest house previously. Location wise it has advantage. Minutes walking to bluemosqu and other cultural things. There is a busy street near hotel,the staff is young and friendly. Good for a short stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Individuality in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mrsbasravi
Reviews.Content: I arrived a day before my husband and I must say at first I was a little hesitant because I admit I am quite spoilt and am used to 5 star luxury so it was going to be the first time I was going to be staying at a guesthouse. As soon as I walked in the door, i met the kindest man ever (the manager) he was so welcoming that i immediately felt reassured. When he took me to the room I was a little upset as it was in the basement and there was no view and there was also a damp smell, but later on I realized not all rooms are like that. The next morning they were kind to move me to a room on a higher floor and the view was quite decent and the room was lovely and smelt great. The breakfast was on the rooftop, and the view from there was spectacular. All the hotel members were genuinely caring and friendly and I would throughly recommend this hotel if you want to be close to all the important sights - Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand bazaar, Basilica Cistern etc. I look forward to returning!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Reception”
Reviews.Author: Gem3234
Reviews.Content: Quite casual kind of atmosphere, I liked the team very polite. Position of Hotel is good, easy to walk to sultanehmet mosque and saint sophia. The rate was nice, I found them on foot by walking inside.

Reviews.Title: “Location is very good”
Reviews.Author: TreitSten
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very near to museums and one busy street full of restaurants caffees. But hotel is in silent place and good to sleep. the room was small but handy. The stairs makes it difficult however no place to make elevator. Good for value.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean & ideally located”
Reviews.Author: m_m2500
Reviews.Content: My wife's first introduction to Turkey, was the Hotel Alp. Was a little aprehensive when making our booking, but shouldn't have worried. Rooms were very clean & extremely comfortable with plenty of hot water. Location was very handy to the major sites of Sutanahamet, Grand Bazaar, Aya Sopfia & the Blue Mosque. An easy walk to the foreshore. Probably not suitable to those that have a problem with stairs, as the staircase might prove a little tricky, especially trying to get to the breakast room on the top floor. This is probably indicative to most hotels located in the old quarter. All in all a very pleasant stay & the staff couldn't be faulted.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy Hotel in IStanbul Downcenter”
Reviews.Author: Gemhore
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very friendly hotel in Istanbul. The rooms are average comfort comparing to its value. It is good for short stay since the room was small. The most advantegous point is the location. It is very close to a crowded street but hotels place is quiet. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “polite and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: heliomf
Reviews.Content: Extremely polite and helpful staff, clean and comfortable rooms, good location.

Reviews.Title: “good location, clean room, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: SeongTeng
Reviews.Content: staying this hotel for 2 nights in istanbul, very helpful staff, providing maps, information bout sight seeing in istanbul. Terrace cafe was nice, breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vagabonder11
Reviews.Content: A nice, clean hotel in a good location. Easy walking to the major sights and a pretty rooftop for breakfast with great views. The staff was very helpful and the rooms were decent.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: maspin555
Reviews.Content: The hotel Alp has a truly helpful and personable staff. Erman and both Mustafas are great fellows, fun to talk to, and just good to be around. This hotel has an absolute lack of pretense. The rooms are clean, the beds very comfortable, showers have good pressure and its good to have a little refrigerator in the room. We stayed in 3 different rooms (2 separate visits and one miscommunication): #404, #303 and #202. #404 is great because you can see the sea and Asia. The rooftop terrace where breakfast is served is very pleasant, with great views of the sea, and if youre a smoker you can have a smoke up here. The breakfast is a good Turkish breakfast: cheese, fruit, olives, yogurt, bread, fruit juice, a sort of borek, tomatoes, cucumbers. Coffee is straight ahead hotel Nescafe in a carafe, the hotel Alps only weak link.

Reviews.Title: “I would go back here again!”
Reviews.Author: CapeTown
Reviews.Content: .Great location, a quiet guest house in the best part of Istanbul. Staff are very friendly and can speak English. They were very accommodating in helping to solve our travel problems and odd information requests. Block out curtains provide for dark rooms. Rooms have fridge and no extra payment air cons. Great upstairs views and the best breakfast we experienced in the whole of our month long stay in Turkey. I would go back there again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: jenny201008
Reviews.Content: Service friendly helpful and effiicient. Relaxed atmosphere. Good turkish breakfast, plus cereals, available till 11 am for late risers. Hungry teenagers can fill up. For the inexpensive price, the rooms, and the en suite showers here are a good size, and cleaned every day.. We had a fantastic holiday in Istanbul and staying at this hotel definitely contributed to that. The view from the terrace is fantastic and you can laze around there drinking tea and just watching the world go by. The location is perfect . The Topkapi and nearby sites are on your doorstep, its about 5 minutes walk from a tram stop, and about 25 mins to the Galata bridge. Next time we go to Istanbul I'll book this hotel early : its the best!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for central location”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityNewYorker
Reviews.Content: Pros: prime location, right near the restaurants, cafes, and major sites in the Old Quarter, clean rooms, rooftop dining for breakfast with good views of the Bosphorus. There were no downsides to the hotel but no memorable upsides other than the location -- that's why I would recommend it as a solid, no frills choice in the Old Quarter but I would not highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the ALP”
Reviews.Author: travlinmucho
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff, really nice rooms---all you could ask for in a small inexpensive priced inn. Thank you for the great hospitality you gave us:):):)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful guesthouse, location and experience”
Reviews.Author: lylie
Reviews.Content: After many hours of searching I came upon the The Alp and it was what I was seeking. Quaint, simple, in a good location. Not over decorated or plush. The Alp has a fresh peaceful style and allows the original architecture to shine. From the easy pick up at the airport to check in and unwinding after a long journey, The Alp was perfect. We really loved our stay. The roof top balcony with delicious breakfast is a treat. Very thoughtful staff and positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: sesameseed7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with three friends at the beginning of a 2 week trip around Turkey. We started off our trip in Istanbul and stayed here for the first three days. Everyone was arriving to Istanbul at different times during the day, the hotel staff was very accommodating and helpful when we needed their help. They also let us use their computer in the reception area whenever we needed to. Our room was facing the street but this was not a problem as the hotel was located on a quiet dead-end street. Overall: clean rooms, great view from the terrace, good Turkish breakfast, great location for sightseeing in Sultanahmet (walking distance to everything), taxi stop nearby, very good value (we stayed four people in one room for about 100 euros) and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A cozy gem of a guesthouse in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: yoribe
Reviews.Content: I was able to get a last minute booking at this guesthouse for my Thanksgiving jaunt to Istanbul. It is located conveniently in tourist-friendly Sultanahmet on a cul-de-sac with great views of the sea. The guesthouse had recently undergone a renovation and my hardwood-floored room was nicely equipped with a canopy bed. Awaking to windows with a view of the Bosporus was a delight, as was having chai and breakfast on the rooftop terrace that has similar views. The room charge was an off-season special for 35 Euros per night, which is a bargain for what was offered! Front desk personnel were friendly and helpful with e-mails prior to my arrival concerning holidays, etc. Overall, I had a relaxing, undisturbed stay here and would heartily recommend it to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: easytraveler84
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here in October and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We stayed the first few nights across the street at Sebnem. However, they were not able to accomodate us on the last night (we were already aware of this when we booked) and Hotel Alp graciously took us in for 70 Euros for a large very clean triple room. The view on the rooftop is amazing and the nice gentleman at the front desk was VERY helpful in assisting us with sightseeing, tours, and even arranged a 5 euro per person shuttle to the airport. The hotel was perfectly located in a very safe area in the Sultanahment and we walked everywhere on foot. Also, a cab ride to the Galata District was very inexpensive and easily accessible for night life. We would definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “A great deal, friendly staff, excellent rooftop terrace”
Reviews.Author: tholepin0
Reviews.Content: Pros: - A good deal for the price (we paid 70 euros/night). - Excellent rooftop terrace - views over the Bosphorus. - Nice fresh breakfast (on the terrace). - Friendly staff. - Good location for accessing the sights in Sultanahmet (by the way, if you love food then take my advice and do NOT bother eating anywhere in Sultanahmet - head to Istiklal street in Beyoglu for dinner instead, for example). Cons: - Sound-proofing in the rooms is standard but not great. - I didn't notice, but my wife says the shower could use a bit of attention. All-in-all: - Great deal, having breakfast on the terrace in the morning is memorable, staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: pixie-boot
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 comfortable nights at Hotel Alp. The rooms were pleasantly furnished and exceptionally clean with the unexpected bonus of a fridge and tv! Double-glazing even meant we didn't hear the 5am call to prayer on two nights (first time across Turkey). Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Our only gripe was the breakfast. The miserable-looking, insipid food was laid out in a very hot room, so go early before the milk and fresh fruit starts to turn!

Reviews.Title: “Afforable awesomeness”
Reviews.Author: eurambler
Reviews.Content: This place was great! Our group of three girls comfortably shared the triple room for three nights and the furnishings/ambiance were perfect. The hotel is on a quiet side street but just a few steps (literally) from a busy and lively main street that is perfect for young people. The front desk staff were always helpful and would hold an hour long coversation about Turkish culture if you show interest. The breakfast is served on the top terrece with a wide view of the Bosphorus and the food itself was fantastic - fresh bread, Turkish cheese, tomato, cucumber, fruit, yogurt, coffee, tea - paired with the friendly breakfast staff this is the best way to start off each day! Go Hotel Alp!

Reviews.Title: “Brill hotel & location - would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: sunnygirl025
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with girlfriends - having never been to Istanbul before - was taking pot luck! But hotel was in fabulous location - close to everything with excellent views. Clean and neat. Only suggestion would be for a covered & lit balcony for poor weather & nights, and just a little variety for breakfast - but other than that a complete thumbs up!! If you go - try Oz restaurant round the corner - good food & prices & chilled atmosphere. Happy holidays!

Reviews.Title: “Great city break hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sotontravellers
Reviews.Content: Many hotels in the area seem to compete for the best views and sun terrace - Alp has a room conservatory and a terrace which allows great views while enjoyed the good breakfast but in the warm (we visited in chilly March). We stayed 3 nights and had great views from our small room but the price was excellent so had nothing to complain about. Great location for old town and main sites - would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “beautifull, cozy, little hotel”
Reviews.Author: petrakis
Reviews.Content: We spent al this fine little hotel seven nights and found it an excellent value for money option. Very well located - just a five minute walk from Ayasofya - has almost everything a family needs: friendly staff, clean and cozy rooms, a small but beatifull terrace facing Bosporus and the Asian coast, a satisfying breakfast -plus free coffee/tea facilities all day long! Everything was perfect for us (but there is not elevator service). We' ll be back for more, that's sure!

Reviews.Title: “They couldn't have been more helpful”
Reviews.Author: onthego32
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Alp for 5 nights in late October. The hotel is on a quiet side street only a few minutes from the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. The rooms and the beds were very comfortable and the rooftop terrace was a delightful place to eat our very good breakfast. There was lots of hot water, the plumbing was new and the rooms and bathroom were kept scrupulously clean. But what made our stay extra special was the kindness, helpfulness and friendliness of all the staff. TMy husband, after losing an encounter with the cobblestones on a side street in Sultanamet, was wearing a walking cast and they were both sympathetic and helpul. They did christen him "Robocop" a title which we all enjoyed. They greeted my attempts at a few words of Turkish with a "thumbs up" every time I tried a new word and they were just generally fun to get to know. So, clean and comfortable accommodation, great breakfast, great views, great location and wonderful staff. We'd stay there again in a minute..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price and great location!!”
Reviews.Author: archaeologygenius
Reviews.Content: The Alp Guesthouse was an excellent value, its only 45 euro during the high season in Istanbul and I believe 35 euro in the low season. Don't worry if you don't have euro with you when it comes to paying they will do the conversion to lira for you. The location of the Alp is right in Sultanamet, within 5 minutes you can be at the Blue Mosque or the Hagia Sofia. The area is filled with hostels and hotels and if you travel alone, like I do, this place is filled with locals and travels having beers at cafes so you will not be alone for long. The only downside is that none of the street have signs to tell you were you are, and it took me a while (about 45 minutes) dragging my bags around town to find it (and that's with asking for help too!!) The room itself, I was in a single, was very clean (no bugs) and the washroom was immaculate (this is super important for me). A made comes in every day and cleans up. I could not believe the cleanliness of this hotel. The desk staff are always around and willing to help, which is definitely a plus. The breakfast is a regular Turkish breakfast with tomatoes, cheese and cucumbers. But there is also bread with jam, yogurt and some meats too. Also coffee and tea, I would pass on the coffee it was way too bitter and made my stomach upset. There are air conditioners which are extremely efficient. I was in the back part of the hotel and was woken every morning by the call to prayer. If possible try to get a room at the front, it will save you being jarred from your sleep by a loud speaker very early in the morning. All in all, the hotel was an excellent value and the location could not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “I felt quite at home at the Alp”
Reviews.Author: Carpeyt
Reviews.Content: In June, 2008, my family and I went to Istanbul for three nights. We have stayed in one of the nicest hotels before (the Divan, in Taksim) and we have stayed twice in another "boutique" hotel in the Sultanahmet region. What we liked about the Alp was that we COULD get wireless internet in the rooms and on the terrace (we had friends in room 301 and we were in 201). The breakfast was a breakfast buffet, and very tasty and satisfying. It was wonderful to go to the terrace as early as 6 AM and watch boats and even a cruise-ship or two on the Marmara. The rooms were very comfortable with nice mattresses, AC and a small refrigerator. The bathroom was small, but adequate (we stayed near Venice once with a bathroom the size of a phonebooth..so no complaining from me...the plumbing was good, with no bad smells and no leakng pipes). The Staff was excellent and the day manager even let me beat him at Backgammon. When I am in Istanbul again, I will definitely stay at the Alp, again!

Reviews.Title: “sweet bed and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: missmetro
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so quaint. We stayed in room 401 which was roomy and had a large shower. It was very clean and without mold as others have complained about. It is nice because you don't have to walk down the main restaurant street to get to the hotel. You can avoid the hawking of all the restaurants to come eat. They, not the rug people, drove us crazy. The hotel is down the street from the Four Seasons Hotel and less than three minutes from the Blue Mosque and etc. You must do a turkish bath while you are there. Several are in walking distance of the hotel. We ate at Doy Doy twice while we were there. Several people mentioned in the forums and it was excellent. The view from the rooftop at breakfast is incredible. Breakfast was decent. We did not have any trouble with the breakfast attendant. she was helpful and gave refills of coffee and tea. She brought bread and cheese outside to me and we laughed and fed the birds. Yes, she did smoke but they do in all the restaurants. Over all is was a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but lacking service and turkish hospitality”
Reviews.Author: jchen811
Reviews.Content: Overview: Istanbul was our very last stop on our turkey tour. Perhaps we have been too spoilt by Turkish hospitality at our other stops that Alp Guesthouse failed miserably in that department. 4 star comfort combined with 1 star hospitality makes it an average 3 star. Rooms: Beautifully decorated and in good condition. Bathroom is clean but room on smallish side. Make sure you request for a room that is facing the street, not the mosque. The windows are not double glazed and you WILL be awoken at 4am. Alp guesthouse did not respond to my e-mail requests about street-facing room and that was a turn off for me. But it was too late for me to change hotels by that point. Upon check in, I asked again for a street-facing room and they said OK. I ended up with the mosque-facing room. Also note that not all rooms have sea view. Our room 404 did not. Hotel: Wonderful terrace with beautiful sea of marmaris views. Reception area is tiny. Price: On the higher side at 65E per double room. The most expensive hotel we stayed at in Turksy. Location: All hotels in the sultanhamet area are pretty much on the same street so you can't really go wrong. 5 min walk to Blue Mosque. Breakfast: Basic turkish buffet breakfast. No special items like borek or omelettes. Internet: Wireless internet did not work for us from our room (404). We had to sit in the stairwell to pick up the signal. The advertised "Wired" internet did not work from the rooms. The LAN outlet was not working and hotel management did not address concern about it. Service/Hospitality: This is where Alp scores low. When we arrived on the first day, we were not offered any tea or breakfast. Unlike the other pensions we stayed at in Turkey. Concerns about room location and internet were not addressed. Because the owner of the hotel was never there, it just felt like any old hotel. Not the homey turkish pensions we've become accustomed to. I get the feeling that all hotels in sultanhamet are going to lack in the hospitality department but I have heard good things about Apricot Hotel. Accommodations in Turkey that scored high on hospitality: Hotel Bella (Selcuk), Melrose Allgau(Pamukkale), Kelebek Pension (Goreme), Angora House (Ankara)
